intro: Berkheya patula, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that resemble those of the oxalis genus. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a unique and ornamental appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Berkheya patula is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
